newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: BOK offers to sell dollars to support won - dealers.
newsitem.headline: BOK offers to sell dollars to support won - dealers.

text.p: The central Bank of Korea (BOK) offered to sell dollars in early morning session on Wednesday at 917.00 won in six-month forward trading to support the won, dealers said.
The won fell to 889.50, the lowest level since the nation launched the market average system in March 1990. It opened at 889.40 and touched a high of 889.20.
Dealers said the widening trade deficit was to blame for the won's fall.
"The won is unlikely to recover in the near future," said a foreign bank dealer.
Dealers said the dollar would test the 890.00 won level today.
